(Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/traits.rs] [Function: charge_execution()] [Race Condition] If multiple threads call charge_execution() concurrently on a shared gas meter, can race conditions in the internal balance update lead to double-charging or under-charging, causing state divergence across validators? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/traits.rs] [Function: charge_storage_fee()] [Unit Conversion Attack] Can an attacker manipulate the gas_unit_price parameter to cause integer overflow when converting from Octa to InternalGasUnit, potentially allowing storage operations without proper payment? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/traits.rs] [Function: charge_storage_fee()] [Fee Bypass] Does the function properly validate that the abstract_amount is positive and within reasonable bounds, or can negative values be passed to credit gas instead of charging it? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/traits.rs] [Function: count_dependency()] [DoS via Dependencies] Can an attacker include excessive dependencies with manipulated sizes to bypass dependency limits by exploiting integer overflow in NumBytes accumulation, enabling DoS through dependency loading? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/traits.rs] [Function: io_gas_used()] [Inconsistent Tracking] Can io_gas_used() return values inconsistent with actual IO operations performed if charge_io() fails partway through, allowing state divergence across validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/traits.rs] [Function: inject_balance()] [Balance Manipulation] Can inject_balance() be called with negative values (through type coercion in Into<Gas> trait) to drain gas balance, allowing unlimited transaction execution? (Critical)
